intro: Brassica johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's mustard, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
